treatment.description: Leaf blades narrowly ovate to ovate or elliptic, 3–12.8 × 1–4.2 cm, (to 14.9 × 8.1 cm on sucker shoots), margins usually strongly revolute. Inflorescences 3.5–8 cm, usually gray-tomentose, rarely with glandular hairs; floral bracts lanceolate-linear to lanceolate-ovate, nearly plane to subnavicular, 2–7 mm. Pedicels 4–8.5 mm. Sepals rarely glandular.
treatment.habitat: Chaparral with Arctostaphylos glandulosa, Cercocarpus sp
treatment.discussion: Subspecies diversifolia occurs in Orange and San Diego counties, and in the mountains of Baja California.
